sentences.english: You could say that she's my female half because we're fraternal twins.
sentences.chinese: 你可以說你是我的半個女人，因爲我們是龍鳳胎。

sentences.english: It is this year's first mixed-sex panda twins born at the base. (See photo)
sentences.chinese: 這是今年該中心第一對熊貓龍鳳胎。

sentences.english: Same-sex twins were, on average, nearly one inch taller than their opposite-sex counterparts.
sentences.chinese: 同性雙胞胎比龍鳳胎平均高出將近一英寸。

sentences.english: The story revolves around a pair of twins, siblings started.
sentences.chinese: 故事圍繞着一對龍鳳胎姐弟倆開始了。

sentences.english: A woman with a twin brother is more masculine than she would if she was born alone.
sentences.chinese: 龍鳳胎出生的女士會比單獨出生更具有男性特點。

definition: to carry on one's ancestral line
(of siblings) having the same father but different mothers/half (brother or sister)
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to become pregnant/to carry a child in the womb
